text: Wait, so you're saying you would not 'do' the cat unless he was wearing the wig? I'm sorry, but thats just picky.

text:
hmmm....no, I don't think so.

sorry towel, but I think we're gonna have to have you put down.

text: In dead earnest.

name: siliconslick
text: the breakfast of champions

name: ganymedeio
text: Man, you don't know doodly-squat.

name: gunsofray
text: I love Asherdan.

name: gunsofray
text: And i would also do Roast Beef in that wig. And the real dead woman he is basically just representing.

name: arcibi
text: A comment left by arcibi was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by KilroyWasHere, rowboat, barfighting, davidbs, tragicone)

name: cthulhu235
text: There is definitely a considerable demographic that these cats are dropping a dime on.

name: whuppins
text: This is why I love Ray: Look how pumped he is in panel 3.

name: jthm_guitarist
text: Look at him in panel 2: ladies wig, banana hammock, and cowboy boots.

name: rykan
text: Sounds like Vince Noir... :O

name: i_love_kate
text: Careful, Rykan. That's how one earns disapproval around these parts.

name: tragicone
text: God, Vince Noir is such a good looking man.

name: octafish
text: He is the upsetter.

name: epicurus
text: I could take or leave this one except for the last panel which makes everything awesome.

name: woof
text: alt text: This is more of a Loretta thing, but Beef really insisted on dressing like Patsy and being involved

name: czarcastic
text: Beef looks like Beck.

name: c_dizzle
text: oh my god you're right and i'm surprised i didn't catch that myself. chubby for joo.

name: varnish
text:
Strum ticka strum ticka strum

I really like that sound effect.

name: gus
text:
I'm pretty sure this is the rhythm guitar for every single Johnny Cash song ever recorded: Strum ticka*I shot a man in Reno*strum*just to watch him die*strum ticka*ring of fire*strum*my name is Sue!*ticka *I walk the line* strum.

(But I do like me some Johnny (strum ticka) Cash (strum) from time to time.

name: poodlelucy
text: the strum ticka is what sold me on this one. very accurate representation of that olde tyme country gee-tar sound.

name: darkwaffle
text: I love why they have country pride.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: As someone who loves country music as much as I do, this strip was like pure bliss.

name: dannygutters
text: beef could play lynn too, they both came from cicrumstances

name: fuckyoufriday
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: doncaballero
text: Nice one, F.Y.F.

name: gumfish
text: Actually, this gif was made by chris himself, I believe. I remember downloading it from the main site way back.

name: professorhazard
text: You can still access it by clicking the non-AssetBar version of the comic.

name: meowmix
text: Now whenever I think of this strip, I can see RB strumming that guitar in my head. Thanks for the visual :)

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Plus he's a left-handed guitarist. I don't think Patsy did that.

name: shutup_shutup
text: Now Beef is playing along with whatever I listen to!  Amazing.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
unless it is Mathcore.

Beef does not play Mathcore.

name: zem
text: "play" and "mathcore" are at opposite ends of the dictionary

name: cpnglxynchos
text: yet sound alike.

name: jesler729
text: I dont know how long it will take me to get the image of Ray in a Loretta Lynn wig, all crazy, yelling "LET'S DO THIS! LET'S DO THIS" out of my head.

name: goosey
text: If you look at Beef's Patsy Cline and let your eyes go out of focus, he suddenly becomes Nice Pete.

name: talix18
text: Thank you for letting me know I wasn't the only one who noticed that.

name: clever-nickname
text: How long has Beef been left-handed?

name: drskradley
text: As long as has been needed to fit it into the parameters of the strip, because Ray was on his right and they both had to face each other and the front.

name: gumfish
text: Or, y'know, as long as he's been fake-playing that guitar. When you're just strumming wildly, you just go with whichever way you got it in your hands.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: dang it!

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Roast Beef: $
Teodor: Quiet around here
Mr. Bear: I do enjoy that Ray.
Little Nephew: ode fokez suqs teh kw0k

name: ford
text:
Mr. Bear's dialog is excellent here.

"I enjoy his honest company and the way he lays a dollar down to die"

name: cpnglxynchos
text: it is odd that Beef would have a dollar sign as a blog title. it's something that you'd more expect from Ray.

name: the_clarkness
text: Roast Beef looks like Nice Pete in panel four. Not a good look for Roast Beef.

name: the_clarkness
text: Dear lord, somebody already mentioned this 6 months before me. If I could lame myself, I would. SHAMEFUL.

name: jonmw
text: I love the way that Beef gets in a little jab at Ray in the third panel.

name: awesomonster
text: I love this strip because it is a good example of how awesome of friends Ray and Roast Beef are. Normal friends do not dress up like country music women from the 50s and 60s together. This is some kind of beautiful.

name: possums
text: You know what? This is a really underrated strip.

name: irondave
text:
"...the hair is great too..."

That is absolute gold, right there.

name: desert_donkey
text:
at least patsy and loretta had some soul. and patsy had the best voice of all time.

nowadays the country western singer girls are just slutty whores that are all flash and pop and *pfft* gone.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: your last sentence is pretty super. a chubby.

name: singtralala
text:
strum ticka strum
beef is a solid guitar player

name: vermy
text:
So... beef has reservations about imitating Jack White, but imitating Loretta Lynn and Patsy Cline is fine in his book.

His psychological profile expands daily.

name: carlyle
text: I like to imagine only Ray attempting to make his voice womanly, Beef's voice staying the same quiet depressed thing it is.

name: greenkoolayd
text:
daddy sang bass
momma sang tenor...

name: shrewbie
text: I did something like this with my sister once
